TopicTitle: [1.12.5] Bluedog Design Bureau - Stockalike Saturn, Apollo, and more! (v1.13.0 "Забытый" 13/Aug/2023)

Articles.Content:
42 minutes ago, Foxxonius Augustus said:

partSSR is the name of the Thor parts.

Yeah, but i don't want to call it SSR.

On 2/8/2016 at 8:05 AM, Sgt.Shutesie said:

Yeah, but i don't want to call it SSR.

Name it the same convention as the real life one. The names of the relevant parts are Odin, Alpha, Alphastar, etc. So Odin, Odin-Alpha, Odin-Alphastar. Odinad? Idk bout that one, probably going to have to come up with something. I'm also unsure of what to do with Agena since that is named RMA.

Somewhat related, but the Thor-Able and Thor-Ablestar can have those triangle fins on them.

On 2/7/2016 at 9:49 PM, VenomousRequiem said:

There's a roadmap, you know...

Hit us with it, Cobalt. Lemme see that to-do.

Well, you asked for it.

I have an idea for a name, Thoda. Thor-Odin-Alpha

@CobaltWolf: Just .3 versions to go, .3. 

PS: Also, Cobalt, here's a question on Gemini. Why not use an IVA from HGR? Since (I think) that's where you got it from.

Midterms feedback came back. Generally speaking, the better you did, the longer the feedback since the professors nitpick more in depth instead of saying the general things you did wrong.

Mine were two sentences each. T.T

Looks like I'm not out of the woods yet.

@Sgt.Shutesie What about Odin + Plus? So it'd be Odinus or Odus.

@davidy12 I have to remake that capsule, or at least the textures. It was inspired by the HGR part but I made it from scratch. I can't just include OrionKermin's IVA, and at any rate, it requires additional props that would add to the ram footprint of BDB.

Speaking of the Karrot IVA, @stratochief66 you're right the portraits in the lower right hand corner don't appear since there's no IVA set for the part. I'll have to set it to the default IVA so that you get portraits. I'm not planning on doing any IVAs for my stuff, since I honestly have no desire to do them and the people that genuinely care (ie would actually run missions from inside and not just look inside once or twice) are a very small minority. If anyone is really upset by that I invite them to make IVAs for the pods and I'll include their IVAs + credit them appropriately.

On the topic of the EVA oddities, the Karrot was the first capsule I made and there are some quirks related to setting them up in Unity. I can take another look at it, it sounds like I mostly just need to adjust the ladder and capsule colliders in Unity.

Edited February 8, 2016 by CobaltWolf
That sucks. Good luck with turning it around!

1 minute ago, CaptRobau said:

That sucks. Good luck with turning it around!

Thanks! Just going to have to work through it tomorrow.

I really would like to stream tonight but it wouldn't start until late-ish (after 8PM EST) and I'm not sure how long I'll be able to work for. In any case, tonight I'm planning on starting to UV unwrap either Diamant or Juno (opinions?) to try and start moving this update forward. I think once I get the pipeline flowing again things will return to normal around here, albeit still at a slower pace.
Well, in celebration of the return of The Walking Dead, we shall call it Odis.

Just thought I would share an awesome video I made with BDB!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xz8j9KK1wi8

I felt pretty spent with my IRL stuff so I put in a couple hours before my night class. The major Juno tanks are unwrapped. The engines, well... need some more work.

OMG!

I've only been off KSP for two months and everything has changed. Cobalt, Ven...you guys have been very busy

Just been updating KSP mods to 1.05, and I'm happy to say BDB is the only parts pack I have needed to download. What a fantastic job you guys have done.

Quick question, I may have missed it but is there an Agena Target Vehicle'esq docking port available?

Ven did a great screenshot of the ATV but I can't find the port anywhere...am I being dumb?

Good to be back

Kal

Hey! Long time no see Kal. Agena Docking Port and Antenna are planned for the next update but I've been slammed with schoolwork so progress is slow.

Oh lord, thank you so much! I'm glad you like it! 

The ATV docking port is a Tantares.625m drouge docking port, on top of a scaled down .625-1.25m adapter. That was before we even had the real secondary engines.

Well, you asked for it.

Can there be a plan to do the BLACK ARROW and Prospero? Just wondering, since it's my country's only orbital launcher. Possibly in release 2? I just haven't found a decent BA. I know SXT has one, but I think that, given the quality of this mod, it could be done waaaay better.

Edited February 10, 2016 by CobaltWolf
Wow saturn is coming close! I cant wait Cobalt!

1 hour ago, drekerb42 said:

Wow saturn is coming close! I cant wait Cobalt!  

Oh dear. To preempt any hype that my be directed towards Saturn/Apollo... no. They're really not that close. I know that on paper it says they're only 2 (3?) releases away (not counting any split releases to keep updates somewhat regular) but they're really not. I look at that list and I see a couple hundred parts and god knows how much work before we get to Saturn/Apollo. My current goal is to try and get this update finished by the end of March, the next by the end of May, and the 1.0 release by the end of the summer (which coincidentally would come close to the one year anniversary of the mod).

EDIT: Those estimates are somewhat conservative to allow for distractions, either in the form of work, other games, or other mod projects that I take on (expanding SEP, for example).

Edited February 10, 2016 by CobaltWolf

@CobaltWolf My Super Juno comment wasn't supposed to generate hype or pressure. That said Super Juno and even some of the proposals made under the Saturn designation are a lot closer than you might think. With the Juno expansion we have all the correct tankage and a precursor to the H-1 in the form of S-3D, all that's needed after that is for the LR-87s to have a bottom attachment point and boom, Saturn A-1 and Saturn B-1.

1 minute ago, Foxxonius Augustus said:

@CobaltWolf My Super Juno comment wasn't supposed to generate hype or pressure. That said Super Juno and even some of the proposals made under the Saturn designation are a lot closer than you might think. With the Juno expansion we have all the correct tankage and a precursor to the H-1 in the form of S-3D, all that's needed after that is for the LR-87s to have a bottom attachment point and boom, Saturn A-1 and Saturn B-1.

I was more referring to people that were getting excited for Saturn / Apollo. Hype is good and all but getting excited doesn't make it happen faster.

H-1 is actually getting made for the Atlas update (after Juno) so by the time I get to Saturn 1 all I'll have to model are the fuel tanks. Though I suppose I'd have to move such engines to a different shared folder or some such... The LR-87-1 is going to get attachment / shroud I just need to get around to it. Making Super Juno / Juno V first stage might be hard even if you have the correct tanks just because of the attach nodes.

I'm a little confused though... exactly how powerful would an H-1 have to be in game in order for a Saturn B-1 to work? That thing is huge... the second stage is 4 Atlas booster engines (or two Titan 1 engines? unclear).

Well astronautix has the thrust of an H-1 at 947.7 kN and the S-3 at 758.7 kN. 190~ kN can easily be made up for with some ahistorical verner engines. That's if it even needs them.

3 minutes ago, Foxxonius Augustus said:

Well astronautix has the thrust of an H-1 at 947.7 kN and the S-3 at 758.7 kN. 190~ kN can easily be made up for with some ahistorical verner engines. That's if it even needs them.

Well like I said the H-1 is coming, if only because it's a cool looking engine and it'd be a shame not to include it. But that'd put the H1 at... I dunno, say 250-300 thrust. Which in the Saturn 1 configuration would give 2000-2400 thrust. Saturn 1... well, 3.75m is small but I'm not sure how much it matters because frankly I think 3.75m looks fine. Correct scaling would be 4.125m. Is 2000-2400 thrust enough to lift a 3.75m rocket?
